climbs.name: Hopscotch
climbs.fa: Jason McNabb, Adam Bergdale, and Caleb Hansen 2011

content.description: A line that should not be missed if in the area. Good formation to get on to find out where you are. Follow a wide, somewhat dirty, crack as it moves out left. Traverse on good hands til you reach the left arete. Follow the groove to the summit. Getting into the groove is the crux.
content.location: Very hard to miss. About 1000ft from the Centennial #89 trail intersection. Route faces trail. Once you round the corner take 3 big steps and drop the rope.

content.description: This is spire formation holds one established route. Hopscotch 5.10- it is a great route and is located directly off the trail a few feet. You can't miss this formation as the Centennial trail runs right under it and the trail makes a corner along the spire itself.
